titleInfo.title: Franklin W. Smith in Boston, Massachusetts to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tennessee

subject.topic: Board of Aid to Land Ownership.
Utopian Impulses of the 19th century such as Nashoba, Ruskin, and Rugby .

subject.geographic: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).

mods.note: Smith has acquired a copy of Edward Everett`s address delivered before the Boston Union Club in 1863 and states that "it is a noble souvenir of the loyalty of E. Tenn." Smith requests facts from Temple to remove fear of the Board to go to "Tableland" in Tennessee in part due to its proximity to the "refugees."
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
